alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 8:13PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN DELAWARE...MAYES AND NORTH CENTRAL CHEROKEE COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM CDT... At 813 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles north of Pryor to 2 miles southwest of Locust Grove. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Jay... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Chouteau... Locust Grove... Salina... Langley... Kansas... Adair... Spavinaw... Disney... Oaks... Pensacola... Hoot Owl... Cherokee State Park... Rose... Leach... Chloeta... Twin Oaks... Spavinaw State Park... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
